etymology.description: Depicts wheat: middle line = ear, upward lines = leaves, downward lines = stem and roots -> horizontal line highlighted the ear -> borrowed for 'to come'
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted wheat, visually representing its structure. It was borrowed for its phonetic similarity to express the concept 'to come.' Over time, this borrowed meaning became predominant, while the original reference to wheat became associated with 麥(麥) (mài, 'wheat') through additional phonetic differentiation.
etymology.simplification: 来 is a simplified form of 來 with fewer strokes, maintaining a similar appearance for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 请你今天来我家(請你今天來我家)，一起喝茶(一起喝茶)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ jīntiān lái wǒ jiā, yīqǐ hē chá.
examples.english: Please come to my house today, and have tea together.
